required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: Nutritional intervention in overweight middle aged individuals with subjective memory complaints.

detailed_description.textblock: Late-onset AD develops over many years during a preclinical period in which neuropathological changes accumulate before dementia is evident. Deposition of amyloid-beta (Aβ) in the brain is the earliest recognized biomarker of AD pathology, and, demographically, Aβ accumulation begins to accelerate at age 50, a period when the incidence of metabolic disturbance increases as well. Hyperinsulinemia associated with insulin receptor resistance has been associated with AD pathololgy, and metabolic disturbance in mid-life increases risk for subsequent dementia. There are indications that subjective memory complaints can be an early indicator of developing neuropathology and may be the first manifestation of future dementia. This research involve intervention studies in different samples of individuals from this population to investigate the extent to which berry fruit supplementation and ketone metabolism might improve memory performance in association with enhancement of metabolic function and related factors. The ultimate goal of this research is to develop interventional approaches that might be applied with at-risk individuals in the preclinical period of dementia to forestall or prevent progression of neurocognitive decline.

primary_outcome.description: HOMA-IR will be derived from fasting glucose and insulin
Performances on examiner-adminstered instruments assessing memory function

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active berry fruit supplement; low carbohydrate
arm_group.description: Either blueberry powder or strawberry powder daily supplementation OR low carbohydrate diet
placebo powder OR higher carbohydrate diet

intervention.intervention_name: Either berry fruit supplement OR nutritional ketosis
intervention.description: Either supplementation with flavonoid-containing berry fruit OR carbohydrate-restricted diet designed to induce ketone metabolism
intervention.arm_group_label: Active berry fruit supplement; low carbohydrate

intervention.intervention_name: Placebo powder OR higher carbohydrate diet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- overweight; subjective memory complaints
Exclusion Criteria:
- diabetes; liver or kidney disease; age-related memory disorder; neurologic or psychiatric condition; substance abuse

overall_official.affiliation: University of Cincinnati Academic Health Center

facility.name: Dept of Psychiatry & Behavioral Neuroscience, UC Academic Health Center
